doc.str: It is an object of the present invention to provide a polyimide-based hybrid material which is industrially and advantageously utilized because of having better gas permeability, electric characteristics, heat resistance, mechanical strength, and the like as compared with the conventional polyimide-based hybrid materials, while keeping chemical resistance, forming characteristics (process characteristics), and the like inherently possessed by polyimide. Provided is a hyperbranched polyimide-based hybrid material constituted of an organic-inorganic polymer hybrid, wherein the organic-inorganic polymer hybrid has a hyperbranched polyimide moiety and an inorganic oxide moiety which are combining each other via covalent bond and constituting a composite structure.

Fang et al, Journal of Membrane Science, 2001, vol. 182, pp. 245-256. cited by other . | Chen et al, Journal of Polymer Science, 2003, vol. 41, No. 13, pp. 2026-2035. cited by other . | Yamada et al, Polymer Processing, 1997, vol. 46, No. 2, extra issue, pp. 2-11. cited by other.
NATIONAL UNIVERSITY CORPORATION NAGOYA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (NAGOYA-SHI, JP), IBIDEN CO., LTD.
NATIONAL UNIVERSITY CORPORATION NAGOYA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (NAGOYA-SHI, JP), IBIDEN CO., LTD.
OBLON, SPIVAK, MCCLELLAND, MAIER & NEUSTADT, L.L.P.
